title: Extracting Thyroid Nodules Characteristics from Ultrasound Reports Using Transformer-based Natural Language Processing Methods. (arXiv:2304.00115v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: The ultrasound characteristics of thyroid nodules guide the evaluation of thyroid cancer in patients with thyroid nodules. However, the characteristics of thyroid nodules are often documented in clinical narratives such as ultrasound reports. Previous studies have examined natural language processing (NLP) methods in extracting a limited number of characteristics (<9) using rule-based NLP systems. In this study, a multidisciplinary team of NLP experts and thyroid specialists, identified thyroid nodule characteristics that are important for clinical care, composed annotation guidelines, developed a corpus, and compared 5 state-of-the-art transformer-based NLP methods, including BERT, RoBERTa, LongFormer, DeBERTa, and GatorTron, for extraction of thyroid nodule characteristics from ultrasound reports. Our GatorTron model, a transformer-based large language model trained using over 90 billion words of text, achieved the best strict and lenient F1-score of 0.8851 and 0.9495 for the extract

translated_title: 采用基于Transformer的自然语言处理方法从超声报告中提取甲状腺结节特征
translated_abstract: 甲状腺结节的超声特征是指导甲状腺癌评估的重要指标。然而，甲状腺结节的特征通常记录在临床叙述中，如超声报告中。先前的研究已经使用基于规则的NLP系统提取了一些限定数量(<9)的特征。在本研究中，多学科团队的NLP专家和甲状腺专家确定了对临床护理有重要意义的甲状腺结节特征，编写了注释指南，开发了一个语料库，并比较了5种最先进的基于transformer的NLP方法，包括BERT、RoBERTa、LongFormer、DeBERTa和GatorTron，从超声报告中提取甲状腺结节特征。我们的模型GatorTron，使用90亿个文本单词进行了训练，该模型是基于Transformer的大型语言模型，实现了最佳的严格和宽松F1-score分别为0.8851和0.9495，从超声报告中提取甲状腺结节特征。
tldr: 本研究采用基于Transformer的自然语言处理方法，通过开发语料库和比较5种最先进的方法，成功提取了甲状腺结节超声报告中的关键特征，其中，GatorTron模型表现最佳。
en_tdlr: This study used transformer-based natural language processing methods to successfully extract key characteristics of thyroid nodules from ultrasound reports, through developing a corpus and comparing 5 state-of-the-art methods. The GatorTron model achieved the best performance.
